paper_abstract: In sparse fuzzy rule-based systems, the fuzzy rule bases are usually incomplete. In this situation, the system may not properly perform fuzzy reasoning to get reasonable consequences. In order to overcome the drawback of sparse fuzzy rule-based systems, there is an increasing demand to develop fuzzy interpolative reasoning techniques in sparse fuzzy rule-based systems. In this paper, we present a new fuzzy interpolative reasoning method via cutting and transformation techniques for sparse fuzzy rule-based systems. It can produce more reasonable results than the existing methods. The proposed method provides a useful way to deal with fuzzy interpolative reasoning in sparse fuzzy rule-based systems.
paper_title: Fuzzy Interpolative Reasoning for Sparse Fuzzy Rule-Based Systems Based on alpha-Cuts and Transformations Techniques
